definitions.definition: a long piece of cloth with a message on it that is carried between two poles or hung in a public place to show support for something

examples.text: A huge banner over the street said ‘Welcome home’.
Protesters carried a banner reading ‘Save our Wildlife’.
The demonstrators carried banners bearing various slogans.
They marched forward with banners waving in the wind.
A banner strung across the road read, ‘Welcome home!’

definitions.definition: a title or advertisement across the top or bottom or down the side of a page on the internet

examples.text: They put up a website banner advising customers to order early.
A banner saying ‘To be continued…’ appeared on the screen.

definitions.definition: claiming to support a particular set of ideas

examples.text: They fought the election under the banner of ‘No new taxes’.

definitions.definition: as part of a particular group or organization

examples.text: Troops are in the country under the banner of the United Nations.

wordOrigin: Middle English: from Old French baniere, ultimately of Germanic origin and related to band ‘musical group’.
